nodes.text: The Ratts Tyerell Foundation was an awareness group dedicating to exposing the dangerous aspects of the sport of podracing. Founded by Deland Tyerell after the death of his father Ratts in the 32 BBY Boonta Eve Classic, the Foundation sought to have the sport outlawed across the galaxy. Although podracing was supported by powerful financial backers, including the Hutt Clan, the group's campaign gained traction in the waning years of the Galactic Republic, gathering new supporters as various criminal aspects surrounding the sport came to light. By 22 BBY, after several famous racers were arrested for various crimes, podracing itself was outlawed within the Core Worlds and viewership dropped by more than fifty percent thanks to the efforts of the Tyerell Foundation.

The Ratts Tyerell Foundation was incorporated into the Star Wars canon in 2015 by the fifty-first issue of Star Wars: Build the Millennium Falcon. It was first referenced in the first issue of HoloNet News, a website which featured in-universe news articles leading up to the events of the 2002 film Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones.
